alternatives.transcript: many veterans still vividly remember the pain and anguish award the fight for freedom to protect the way of life all Americans hold so dear

veterans deserve respect and gratitude for their acts of heroism currently many veterans and their guests who want to smoke in VA hospitals must face the humiliation of being sent outside forced to endure miserable weather simply to exercise their freedom of choice veterans deserve better than this

in the true American tradition of protecting our rights we ask you to join us in our efforts to protect the rights of veterans in VA hospitals across the country because if we don't make ourselves heard our rights are going to be stripped away from us one by one
veterans a new battle has just begun
pictures from the past rules to live by
many of the men and women who laid their lives on the line to protect Freedom are now being denied basic rights of decency and Humanity

veterans Nationwide are pulling together to help fellow veterans the VFW and the American Legion have recognized the need to protect veterans rights that is why these prominent organizations have overwhelmingly endorsed resolutions opposing the elimination of designated smoking areas in VA hospitals
there is something that can be done to re-establish a little dignity for these forgotten Heroes

the men and women who fought America's Wars didn't do it for honor and I didn't do it for benefits the fact remains however that this Grateful Nation promise those men and women certain benefits the question is now whether they'll receive those benefits with the dignity and the appreciation that they have the right to expect veterans rights is an important issue women veterans have a right to privacy adult veterans have a right to choose those activities that any adult in our society can

unfortunately unless veterans stand up to protect the rights that are grateful nation promised them those rights just like this nation without their defense will soon not exist what veterans should do is join a local veterans organization contact their Congressman right the president of the United States let him know that all veterans want is the rights they fought to win

we can't forget why these men and women died for our country Freedom many Americans take for granted the Liberty that was one on the battlefields the right to travel without restriction freedom of religion the right to work where we want those are just a few privileges we enjoy in this great country but the fight to protect our freedom is a never
and big battle Americans have a voice to make a difference support the basic rights of our veterans they deserve better than this

I got drafted the 60s spend time in a VA hospital I know what it's like the men there don't get taken care of the way they should they need more they need help they need us to help them don't take away the rights they have now my dad is a World War Two veteran he put his life on the line for his country now I want to do what I can to preserve his rights and the rights of other veterans you should get involved to to help preserve their rights and freedoms these men are going to come home I forgive
everything they've had mentally emotionally drained they need their basic rights their common courtesy and they need to be taken care of properly
it is not a question of just these basic rights it's not a question of smoking or non-smoking it's a question of common courtesy and decent treatment
doesn't anybody recognize the irony of the

veterans fought to preserve our basic rights and freedoms and now their basic rights and freedoms are in danger we need to get involved and we need your help
don't take away their basic freedom and rights
what every veteran should do is contact us Congressman right the president of the United States let them know you're not going to stop fighting for rights yours and everyone else's
the battle is just beginning

veterans let your voice be heard postcards will be distributed with this video take the time to write your congressmen and senators in Washington d.c. ask them to support the veterans dignity and Health Care Act of 1991 mandating adequate indoor smoking areas at VA hospitals across the country veterans deserve basic rights the sooner we take action the faster our war heroes will be able to come in from the cold
veterans deserve better than this
